title.value: Fairness Through Domain Awareness: Mitigating Popularity Bias For Music Discovery
title.justification: The title is extracted from the paper.
title.quote: Fairness Through Domain Awareness: Mitigating Popularity Bias For Music Discovery

extractions.description: The paper focuses on mitigating popularity bias in music recommender systems, particularly in graph neural network (GNNs). The authors propose a domain-aware, individual fairness-based approach to address the issue. They argue that their approach, by considering the similarity of music tracks, leads to a more relevant discovery of niche content. The authors demonstrate their approach on two music recommendation tasks, Automatic Playlist Continuation and Weekly Discovery, and show that it outperforms existing fairness benchmarks in terms of both performance and the recommendation of lesser-known content.

type.justification: The paper proposes a new model and evaluates it on two datasets.
type.quote: Through a series of empirical results, we show that our fairness framework enables us to outperform a series of accepted fairness benchmarks in both performance and recommendation of lesser known content on two important music recommendation tasks.

name.justification: The paper focuses on mitigating bias in music recommender systems.
name.quote: As online music platforms grow, music recommender systems play a vital role in helping users navigate and discover content within their vast musical databases.

name.justification: The authors propose an approach to improve fairness in music recommendation, which is based on graph neural networks. However, they don't specify the architecture and don't name their model.
name.quote: In this work, we propose a domain aware, individual fairness based approach for facilitating engaging music discovery.

is_compared.quote: Finally, we compare our individual fairness-based method with three other methods which are grounded in other canonical fairness notions and are not domain-aware.
